'Since the harbor was unsuitable...the majority decided that we should sail on.' God doesn't guide us by the majority vote, He guides us by His Spirit. 2) They were impatient to get to where they were going. There's not a single verse in the Bible that tells us to hurry up or we'll miss God! In the wilderness Israel learned that when the cloud moves, you move; when the cloud stops, stay where you are and wait on God. 3) They failed to listen to God's Word. 'But the centurion, instead of listening to what Paul said, followed the advice of the pilot' (Acts 27:11 NIV). Be careful, if you look hard enough you'll find someone who just agrees with what you want to do and that can get you into trouble. 4) They looked to the circumstances instead of God to guide them. 'When a gentle south wind began to blow, they thought they had obtained what they wanted; so they...sailed. Before very long...The ship was caught by the storm' (Acts 27:13-15 NIV). The idea that if the circumstances work out right it must be God's plan isn't biblical, in fact for many people in the Bible the proof was the total opposite. Sometimes God leads you through the problem, not around it. He'll never lead you anywhere that doesn't require His provision and protection. So if you want to avoid shipwreck ask God to show you the right way, which is His way!

content.title: Word Up
content.introtext:
SPEAK TO ONE ANOTHER IN PSALMS, HYMNS AND SPIRITUAL SONGS. SING AND MAKE MUSIC IN YOUR HEART TO THE LORD

(EPHESIANS 5:19 NIV)
The Bible is stuffed full of what GOD has to say about the things WE say. Words are powerful, they can big you up or batter you down and how we speak to ourselves and each other makes a difference. Paul talks about the importance of using the words in psalms, hymns and spiritual songs. So why are they so important? 1) Get Real: Check out the psalms and you will find the songwriters are full on with their honesty. They are keeping it real with God and with other people. Check out Psalm 51. Imagine writing a song about how you messed up and then it gets released in the charts, so everyone knows. God loves this honesty and it's good for us for when we are real with Him. 2) Get Close: Hymns and songs help us get closer to God. They can express something that we could just think of or say. God loves to get close to people who are singing or rapping about how much they adore Him. 3) Get the true view: When we big God up through spiritual songs it helps us to see things as they really are! He is our awesome, all powerful Dad, who is in total control of our lives and problems! Today most of your words to God and Christian mates will be about friends, family, school, the person you fancy. The more that you use words to big God up the bigger the difference it will make to your day. Don't wait until Sunday, bang on your best Christian CD and let rip!

content.title: We R family
content.introtext:
WE MUST BEAR THE 'BURDEN' OF BEING CONSIDERATE OF THE DOUBTS AND FEARS OF OTHERS.

Romans 15:2 TLB
Today we're going think about that person in your youth group that winds everyone up. In every group there's at least one real pain. The thing is, Jesus even loves annoying people (which is good news for you eh?)! So, will we love them as sisters and brothers and treat them with respect? In a real family acceptance isn't based on how smart, beautiful or talented you are; it's based on the fact that you belong to each other. 'Be devoted to each other like a loving family. Excel in showing respect' (Romans 12:10 GWT). It's the same deal with your youth group; you are family! 'But you don't know how annoying they are!' Ok, but try and put yourself in their shoes and understand where that person is coming from. When you know what they've been through or is still going through it'll help you be more understanding. Sometimes a person's whole attitude and their annoying behaviour can change when they think people are listening to them. So another part of showing consideration is not downplaying other people's doubts or difficulties. Just because you don't have a problem with something doesn't mean you don't take their problems seriously! People need a safe place to share their struggles and make mistakes without being judged. Oh yeah, and they have a right to expect confidentiality! What's shared in your group needs to stay in your group, and your group needs to deal with it, not go out and blab about it to others. Only in the safe place of acceptance will people open up and share their deepest needs. So show some love this week!

content.title: Focus on your future!
content.introtext:
FORGET WHAT HAPPENED LONG AGO! DON'T THINK ABOUT THE PAST. I AM CREATING SOMETHING NEW

Isaiah 43:18-19
It's not God who's bringing up your past mess ups and mistakes! His Word says, 'But I wipe away your sins because of who I am. And so, I will forget the wrongs you have done' (Isaiah 43:25 CEV). Satan loves dragging up your past; the Bible calls him an accuser. He will bring up old memories in an attempt to discourage you, saying 'you're no good', 'you'll never change,' that 'God doesn't use people who have done stuff THAT bad'. Don't let him lie to you! The Bible says: 'Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way' (NIV). God has given you a new start. God is going to make a way for you! By the way, you don't need to keep coming back to God time and time again saying sorry for the stuff you did three days, months, or years ago. Everyday we need to know that we mess up, we need to decide that we want to change and ask forgiveness, then it's done; God has forgotten it. As surely as Pharaoh and Herod tried to wipe out every baby boy in order to get at Moses and Jesus, so satan will do whatever it takes to keep you from reaching your destiny or being the person God created you to be. A big way he does that it to trap you in the past. The battle is always over your future! No matter what your past is like your future is worth fighting for - so rise up and fight! .

content.title: By God's grace you can overcome!
content.introtext:
THE ONE WHO IS IN YOU IS GREATER THAN THE ONE WHO IS IN THE WORLD.

1 John 4:4 NIV
Robbie Williams had a teacher who thought he was a 'kid who wouldn't amount to much'. What must that teacher feel like now? The world-famous author, Rudyard Kipling received a rejection letter after applying for a job with a newspaper, it said, 'Sorry Mr. Kipling, but you just don't know how to use the English language.' After a lifetime of defeats, at 62, Winston Churchill became one of Britain's greatest Prime Ministers. Einstein's schoolteachers described him as, 'mentally slow, unsociable and adrift in his foolish dreams.' By age 46, Beethoven was completely deaf, yet he wrote some of his greatest symphonies without hearing a note. Life is about overcoming! You conquer one mountain, and then before you know it you're faced with the next; a bigger one. Remember Peter who denied Jesus in a moment of weakness, and Jonah who ran from the call of God because he was afraid? We can all mess up or want to give up. In every story of victory there are chapters of defeat. But by God's grace you can overcome! That's why the Bible says: 'The one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.' Hudson Taylor, an amazing missionary said, 'Many Christians estimate difficulty in the light of their own resources, thus they attempt very little and they always fail. The real giants have all been weak people who did great things for God because they reckoned on His power and His presence to be with them.' Bottom line: God has got your back, don't worry about failing, worry about what you're going to tell God if you don't even try!

content.title: 3 quick tips for growth
content.introtext:
IF ANYONE WOULD COME AFTER ME, HE MUST DENY HIMSELF ...TAKE UP HIS CROSS AND FOLLOW ME.

(MATTHEW 16:24 NIV)
1) Deny yourself: When you became a Christian you put Jesus in the driving seat of your life! He's in control and decides what direction your life is going. We've all heard of back seat drivers, passengers who tell the driver what to do 'Speed up!', 'slow down!'. Don't become a back seat driver to Jesus, saying He's in control but also wanting things your own way. Denying yourself means trusting Jesus knows best for your life and not just going in the direction or speed you think is right! 2) Take up your cross. In a letter to a church, Paul says: 'I die daily' (1 Corinthians 15:31). Certain things in your life can be handled only one way; dying to them, cutting them off. 'Sin speaks a dead language that means nothing to you...You are dead to sin and alive to God' (Romans 6:11 MSG). If a manager could have the world's best striker join their football team, they would seriously consider selling off their current striker. Jesus wants us to give Him space in our lives each day which means sacking anything that gets in His way or becomes more important. Die to sin but gain Jesus! 3) Follow Him. It is not God's job to follow you, it is your job to follow Him! When you do, it will cost you, change you, and challenge you. Sometimes you will have a rough ride, other times you will be cruising. You must be willing to follow Him anywhere, any time, under any conditions; that is the deal! Still want to be a disciple of Jesus?

content.title: 3 quick tips for guidance
content.introtext:
WE SHOULD MAKE PLANS - COUNTING ON GOD TO DIRECT US.

Proverbs 16:9 TLB
It's said when Christopher Columbus (one of the first European explorers to discover America) set out he didn't know where he was going, when he arrived he didn't know where he was, and when he returned didn't know where he'd been! From time to time we all need help knowing which direction to go; which college or university to go to, should you take a certain job, or whether or not to start going out with that special someone! The Bible says, 'We should make plans - counting on God to direct us.' So how does He lead us? Through: 1) The Bible: 'Let the word of Christ -the message- have the run of the house. Give it plenty of room in your lives' (Colossians 3:16 TM). One author writes: 'The Bible is to God what a surgical glove is to a surgeon. He reaches through it to touch deep within you.' But that requires reading it, personalizing it, and acting on it. 2) Prayer and listening for His voice: Jesus said, 'My sheep listen to my voice; I know them and they follow me' (John 10:27 NIV).It can take time to learn to listen not just talk at God, try going for a walk, find a quiet place, give yourself time. Write down what you think Jesus might be saying-does it match what the bible says? Learn to listen. 3) Get Advice: other people have gone through the same stuff as you, so 'Remember what kind of lives they lived and try to have faith like theirs' (Hebrews 13:17 CEV). Remember your youth leaders, pastors and yes, even parents, were your age once! They can help.

content.title: But God (2)
content.introtext:
I WANTED...TO WRITE...ABOUT...SALVATION...BUT...FELT THE NEED TO WRITE YOU ABOUT SOMETHING ELSE.

Jude 3 NCV
The author Max Lucado writes, 'I awoke early one morning for a meeting...[and] spotted a bag of cookies. Our daughter had attended a bake sale so I thought she must've set them out for me. I ate one...interesting texture...I ate a second...with coffee it made an interesting option. I grabbed a third for the road, and would have grabbed the fourth but only one remained. Later my wife phoned, "Looks like someone's been in the bag." "It was me," I admitted. "I've had better breakfast cookies but those weren't bad." "Those weren't breakfast cookies," she replied, "they were homemade dog biscuits!" All day when I scratched my belly, my leg kicked...not to mention my interest in fire hydrants! I should've consulted the maker.' The Bible says, 'God is working in you to help you...do what pleases him' (Philippians 2:13 NCV). So when you sense a 'but God' holding you back in your spirit He's probably trying to get your attention for a good reason. He promised to 'guide you along the best pathway for your life....advise...and watch over you' (Psalm 32:8 NLT) so you need to listen to Him and do what He says! Jude said, 'I wanted very much to write you about salvation...But I felt the need to write...about something else.' Jude wanted to dedicate his epistle to one topic but God had other plans. Get in the habit of asking God what to do, but also get in the habit of listening. You might have plans but God has His plans, so stop, ask and listen. Remember, when you ask, sometimes NO is just as important to hear as YES!

content.title: But God (1)
content.introtext:
I...INTENDED TO BUILD...BUT GOD SAID.

1 Chronicles 28:2-3 NAS
Vincent was a missionary in a small coal mining village in Belgium. He preached to miners, looked after the injured, fed the hungry and after a while his little church was rammed with those eager to learn about Jesus. Vincent's bosses weren't happy though, because unlike most vicars at the time, Vincent wore old second-hand clothes, lived in a shack and gave his salary to the people. 'You look worse than the people you came to teach,' they said. 'Wouldn't Jesus have done the same?' Vincent asked. His bosses disagreed and he was told to leave the church. Vincent was hurt and angry; his only desire had been to build a church that glorified God, so why hadn't God let it happen? Then one day he watched an old miner struggling beneath a load of coal. Moved by the sight he began to sketch the bowed figure. And although he didn't realise it at the time, he'd discovered his real calling. The young preacher who was rejected by his denomination eventually became the now world famous artist: Vincent van Gogh. How do you react to the 'But God' interruptions in your life? Do you get mad at God? David said, 'I...intended to build a...home for the ark...But God said "Your son Solomon...shall build My house"' (1 Chronicles 28:2-6 NAS). When God axed his plans, David immediately followed his 'But God' with a 'Yet God,' and declared, 'Yet... God...took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel' (v. 4). Instead of complaining about what he didn't get to do, David buzzed about how God had already blessed him by promoting him from herding sheep to leading the Israelite nation!

content.title: Respect is due!
content.introtext:
JESUS STOOD UP AND COMMANDED THE WIND AND SAID TO THE WAVES, 'QUIET! BE STILL!'

MARK 4:39 NCV
In Mark Chapter 4 you'll find a story about how even the wind and waves were at Jesus' beck and call. In the middle of a raging storm Jesus stands up in the boat, tells the wind and the waves to chill out and... bosh! The sea is calm. Jesus' mates clock hold of this and think to themselves, 'Who is this? Even the wind and waves respect this guy'. Life today is full of people who are trying to get respect, like the rappers on TV with women and bling hanging on them. Their whole attitude is 'you KNOW you want to be like me'. and a lot of people do! Or think of the toughest kid in school or on the streets that everyone wants to hang out with or go out with, yet you know that no matter how much respect they think they deserve none of these fakers get respect from creation itself! Because we know Jesus was full of love, some people seem to think that Jesus is some geek who is coming up to us saying: 'erm, excuse me, will you believe in me please, it will be really nice'. Sometimes we can think that we're doing Jesus a favour if we follow Him, or do what He says. No way. Jesus is the chief, the guv, 'da man' and He demands our respect more than anyone that's ever lived. Even the forces of nature listen to him, so shouldn't you? If this doesn't sound like the Jesus you know, you haven't got to know Him yet, so what are you waiting for? Respect is due!

content.title: Exfoliate
content.introtext:
CREATE IN ME A CLEAN HEART, O GOD.

PSALM 51:10 NLT
Jesus taught us that only the pure in heart would 'see God' (Matthew 5:8). The problem He's pointing out here is that our vision becomes dim when our heart is polluted. To the blind all things are invisible. Today's headline verse is the cry of David's heart when he was confessing his darkest sins to God. He fell on his knees and prayed: 'Create in me a clean heart, O God.' At this point in his life he'd stuffed up BIG TIME but he got this one thing right, he knew the best heart-cleaner in the business. Nothing or nobody else can produce purity in the deepest part of your being. You can't get it from the supermarket, you can't buy it off the internet. Only the blood of Jesus will remove those stains. Jesus himself said, 'You are clean because of the word I have spoken to you' (John 15:3). Time spent reading the Bible acts like a daily exfoliator (weird gritty cream your mum uses!) keeping you clean by exposing sins you're unaware of so that you can deal with them. Think of it like this: unidentified, unconfessed, sin is like dirt in your skin pores, which leads to what? Zits! In the same way, not scrubbing in the Word is a sure fire way to end up with a dodgy spiritual complexion! You'll find yourself constantly needing prayer instead of being in the place where you can offer prayer for others. In short, you need to be cleansed and then stay clean so that you can hear God and see the direction He's leading you in.

content.title: A little voice from the balcony
content.introtext:
ENCOURAGE ONE ANOTHER AND BUILD EACH OTHER UP.

1 THESSALONIANS 5:11 NIV
A famous singer was to perform at the Grand Opera House. The concert hall was packed. Suddenly the house manager announced, 'Ladies and gentlemen I regret that due to illness our special guest will be unable to perform this evening. But we've found another singer, an equally great talent, so would you please give her a warm welcome.' The crowd groaned so loudly that nobody even heard the singer's name. You could feel the disappointment everywhere. The stand-in singer gave it everything she had but when it was over all she got was shallow applause followed by uncomfortable silence. Suddenly there was the sound of a little voice from the balcony, a child shouting, 'Mum, you're amazing!' All of a sudden the crowd jumped to their feet and gave her a standing ovation that lasted for several minutes. There are people around you today who are hurting inside, crumbling under the load they silently carry, who never hear the words, 'You're amazing.' Why? a) because we're too embarrassed to say them b) we don't think they need to hear them because they seem so strong. Listen to what Paul writes, 'There was no rest for us... Battles on the outside and fear on the inside. But God, who encourages those who are discouraged, encouraged us by the arrival of Titus. His presence was a joy... so was the news he brought' (See 2 Corinthians 7:5-8 NLT). Even the Apostle Paul needed encouragement! So God sent the bloke called Titus. 'His presence was a joy...so was the news he brought.' God needs more people who will shout out from the balcony. Today you can be one of them!

content.title: iHeroes
content.introtext:
TO ONE HE GAVE FIVE TALENTS, TO ANOTHER, TWO, AND TO ANOTHER, ONE.

MATTHEW 25:15 NAS
In a world that celebrates fame and fortune how do you handle being Mr or Ms Invisible? Do you secretly resent the people who get the big breaks and the open-door opportunities? Before you answer consider this: there was only one Moses whose amazing career spans four Old Testament books, and only one Paul who was called to write half the New Testament. The rest of us are called to be heroes of a different kind, we're the 'iHeroes'; we are invisible, but important. Invisible because we are 1 out of 6 billion people on the planet and that's a very big crowd! Important because our value was established at the cross. So, when people overlook you, stop and remind yourself 'God values me so highly that He thought I was worth dying for.' Have you heard about the one-note musician? She unpacked her violin, took her seat in the orchestra, arranged her music sheets and tuned up her instrument. As the concert began the conductor cued one group of musicians after another until finally her moment arrived, the time for her one note to be played! The conductor signalled, she played the note and the moment was over. Just like that! The orchestra played on and the one-note player sat there quietly for the rest of the concert; not disappointed that she'd played only one note but with a sense of fulfilment that she'd played it in tune, on time, and with style! Have you heard of Ananias? He shows up once in the Bible, to leads Paul to Christ, then bye (Acts 9:10-19). He's a one-note player, but what a note! Take a lead from him!

content.title: Tough Love
content.introtext:
AN HONEST ANSWER IS A SIGN OF TRUE FRIENDSHIP.

PROVERBS 24:26 TEV
It's tempting to keep quiet when your mates are messing up, you don't want to sound like a grumpy old man - but keeping shtum isn't the loving thing to do. Most people have no one in their lives who loves them enough to tell them the truth, so they continue going the wrong way making bigger and bigger mistakes. Usually we know what needs to be said but fear keeps us from saying it. If you ever find yourself in that situation remember this proverb: 'An honest answer is the sign of true friendship.' Sometimes caring means confronting, or, as they say, dishing out some 'tough love'. Are you willing to be that sort of friend? It's the only sort of friend worth having. Paul writes, 'If someone in your group does something wrong, you who are spiritual should go to that person and gently make him right again' (Galatians 6:1 NCV). That's what 'spiritual' people do! The trouble is when an issue pops up that might cause tension it's immediately glossed over in order to preserve the peace. Mr. 'Don't-rock-the-boat' jumps in and tries to smooth everyone's ruffled feathers, the issue is never resolved and everyone lives with a feeling of frustration. 'No more pretence. Tell the truth. In Christ's body we're all connected to each other...When you lie to others, you end up lying to yourself' (Ephesians 4:25 TM). Now, truth without love can really sting, thoughtless words hurt people but the bottom line is: whether in a friendship, a family or even a church, until we care enough to confront and resolve the real issues, we'll never grow close to each other!

content.title: Times of testing
content.introtext:
UNTIL THE TIME CAME TO FULFILL HIS WORD, THE LORD TESTED JOSEPH'S CHARACTER.

PSALM 105:19 NLT
It's hard to watch God blessing other people while you're struggling to get by. But before you throw a strop and say 'it's so unfair!' remember, it's just God's calendar, your time will come. We've mentioned Joseph quite a few times in this edition and once again his story is so relevant. His faith was tested by the massive promises God gave him. You can almost hear the voices in his head whispering: 'I thought your dream said you were supposed to be sitting on a throne. What are you doing sat here in prison then? God doesn't care about you.' But Joseph never gave in to negativity. He held on to those dreams. He knew God doesn't change His mind, so he made sure he didn't change his! When you follow where God leads you can find yourself in the weirdest places, places that don't always seem like they are going to be good places. But there's always a reason. God told the prophet Elijah to go and hide himself in a dusty ravine by a brook where his only friends were birds (1 Kings 17:3). Only later was the importance of this time revealed. This time hidden away with God focused him on the challenge ahead, defeating a twisted queen and her evil priests. Listen: 'The Lord will withhold no good thing from those who do what is right' (Psalm 84:11 NLT). His delays are not denials. He's never said anything He couldn't back up or promised anything He wouldn't deliver. So try thinking a bit less about your surroundings and a bit more about the Word God has given you!

content.title: Who matters?
content.introtext:
I THANK MY GOD EVERY TIME I REMEMBER YOU.

PHILIPPIANS 1:3 NIV
There's a true story of a little boy whose sister needed a blood transfusion. The doctor explained she had the same disease that he'd recovered from two years earlier. Her only chance of recovery was a transfusion from someone who'd already beat it, so the boy was the perfect donor. 'Would you give your blood to Mary?' the doctor asked. Johnny paused, his lower lip trembled, and then he smiled and said, 'For my sister, yes I will.' Soon the two children were wheeled into the hospital room; Mary, pale and thin; Johnny, fit and healthy. Neither spoke, but when their eyes met Johnny grinned. But as the nurse inserted the needle into his arm Johnny's smile faded. He watched the blood flow through the tube. After a little while Johnny's voice, slightly shaky, broke the silence. 'Doctor, when do I die?' Only then did the doctor realise why little Johnny had paused and why his lips trembled when he agreed to donate his blood. He thought giving his blood to his sister meant giving up his life. In that brief moment he'd made an awesome decision. Who would give their life for you? Whoever they are, they are the people you should be making time for. They are the ones you need to show your appreciation for; now, while you still can. They are irreplaceable! When they're gone you'll realise that. Some of the things you're striving for now will seem empty then. Some of the things you're upset over now will seem pointless then. So squeeze the most out of every moment you get with them. Create memories you'll treasure with those who matter!

content.title: The Jabez label
content.introtext:
GOD GRANTED HIS REQUEST.

1 CHRONICLES 4:10 NIV
Jabez is an ancient name that means 'a cause of pain'. Imagine growing up with a name like that! But this Jabez refused to wear the loser label and you should too! You don't need to wear any of the labels people try to stick on you. Your identity is that you are a unique child of the awesome God and nothing less. The Bible says that you were in God's mind before you were in your mother's womb (See Psalm 139:13-15). Jabez wouldn't let his beginnings dictate his end. He refused to allow his family to keep him down and his bounderies to keep him in. Listen to his prayer, 'Oh, that you would bless me and enlarge my territory! Let your hand be with me, and keep me from harm so that I will be free from pain.' God granted his request. OK, so at first it seems like a bit of a selfish prayer, it doesn't really beat in time with the rhythm of prayer Jesus taught his disciples in Matthew Chapter 6 but something about it obviously got through to God because he answered it. It's not very often that we read about Jesus being 'amazed' but interestingly the times He is are times when He meets people who have a determined faith that He will do the thing they ask Him for. You can be sure that Jesus has not changed and He will still respond to anyone who dares to believe that He has the power to do the things He has promised in His Word. The question is, do you? Well, be like Jabez and get praying.

content.title: Citizens of God's nation
content.introtext:
THY KINGDOM COME, THY WILL BE DONE.

MATTHEW 6:10
We're gonna dig out a bit of history today. A couple of hundred years ago, before the British and the French imposed national boundaries on Southeast Asia, the kings of Laos and Vietnam already had an agreement about who was Laotian and who was Vietnamese. Those who ate short-grain rice, built their houses on stilts and decorated their homes with Indian-style serpents were considered Laotians. Those who ate long-grain rice, built their houses on the ground, and decorated their homes with Chinese-style dragons were Vietnamese. The kings taxed the people accordingly so they had no need for boundaries. It was simple; each person belonged to the kingdom whose values they shared and whose king they honoured! Understand this: you can only live by the values of one of two kingdoms: the kingdom of darkness or the kingdom of light. Which have you chosen? Each time you choose God's way in your life the kingdom of God comes into the world through you. When you live out his values the prayer Jesus taught us is answered, 'Your kingdom come, Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.' So how do citizens of God's nation act? Jesus says a) they aren't big-headed b) they live by God's priorities c) they're hungry and thirsty for more of God d) they show compassion to others e) they have a pure heart f) they are peacemakers g) they stay positive, even in hard times h) they know their reward is waiting for them (Matthew 5:3-12). What the world knows about the nation of God is what is displayed in our lives! That's a big responsibility!

content.title: Trouble ahead - talk to Joseph!
content.introtext:
YOU INTENDED TO HARM ME, BUT GOD INTENDED IT FOR GOOD.

GENESIS 50:20 NIV
So maybe you're not exactly looking forward to 2008. Maybe you can learn from the story of Joseph? a) your future is in the palace not in the pit! b) your future isn't in the hands of other people, it's in the hands of God c) your future doesn't require the cooperation of everyone else, but it does require the cooperation of one person; you! In his life Joe was on the receiving end of a whole load of agro. His brothers sold him to a gang of human traffickers. His boss's wife lied about him, saying he tried to grope her. His best mate in prison turned his back on him, but God didn't abandon him! He arranged every step Joseph took, all the way to becoming Prime Minister. There's a really special moment in his story when he stands face to face with his brothers, the ones who sold him to the gang when he was just a teenager, and says: 'You intended to harm me; but God intended it for good.' Get this: No one can prevent God from using you, blessing you and giving you success, except you. So keep your heart and your attitude right! For everything there's a reason and a season. Maybe you can't understand it at the moment, so just hold tight to what God's promised you. Instead of looking for someone to blame, look for the hand of God in your situation. Remember what the Bible says: 'All that happens to us is working for our good if we love God and are fitting into his plans' (Romans 8:28 TLB).

content.title: Honesty Day
content.introtext:
JESUS WOULD OFTEN GO TO SOME PLACE WHERE HE COULD BE ALONE AND PRAY

LUKE 5:16
OK, January 1st, time for an honesty check! Have you been living 2007 with a bit of a 'Go-faster stripes' attitude? Do you ever catch yourself thinking, 'If God has anything to say to me today He'd better hurry up and say it?' It's so easy to get like this. The 21st century 'microwave mentality' demands everything instantly, including spiritual maturity. That's why today, seeing as it's a bank holiday, we're gonna chill. Sorry no, let's-hurry-up-so-we-can-get-on-with-it today! When was the last time you really made an effort to listen to God and get direction? Well, what better day than today to set aside some proper time to talk to God. Get out of the house, take a hike, download some worship trax onto that new MP3 player you got for Crimbo and stretch those legs. Stick a Bible in your pocket, or in your rucksack, or stuff it in your coat and grab a felt-tip to mark the bits that the Holy Spirit leads you to. If you want God to work through you this year then you need to let Him work in you today. The Bible says, 'Jesus would often go to some place where he could be alone and pray' (Luke 5:16 CEV). Loneliness is the price of hearing from God and walking in His will. There's no shortcut to any place worth going. If prayer was part of the life of Christ, shouldn't it be a part of yours? Don't get so busy with other things that you lose sight of what's important; doing what God wants you to do!

content.title: Prodigal, come home!
content.introtext:
I WILL ARISE AND GO TO MY FATHER.

LUKE 15:18
In Luke 15 a son demands his inheritance money before he's ready for it. It turns out to be the worst thing to ever happen to him. Earlier in this chapter Jesus tells two other stories about a shepherd who went looking for a lost sheep and a woman who went looking for her lost silver. They were lost accidentally, but this kid left on purpose. He 'packed up everything he owned and left for a foreign country, where he wasted all his money in wild living. He had spent everything, when a bad famine spread through that whole land. Soon he had nothing to eat' (Luke 15:13-16 CEV). The turning point of the story is when the son says, 'I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, "Father, I have sinned."' Notice three important statements: a) 'I will arise.' Everybody falls; the winners are the ones who get back up again b) 'And go back to my father.' If you're sick of religion or trying and constantly failing - try Jesus, He won't disappoint you! c) 'And will say unto him, "Father, I have sinned."' Today, pray and make things right between you and your heavenly Father. This lad took himself away and he let himself down, but he picked himself up and he brought himself back. The same goes for you! Solomon writes, 'There is a way that seems right to a man but in the end it leads to death' (Proverbs 14:12 NIV). What seems like a good idea today may cost you seriously tomorrow. So trust God when He says 'No', he's not being tight, He can see what's best for you.

content.title: Blind skiers
content.introtext:
I WILL GUIDE THEM...I WILL NOT FORSAKE THEM.

ISAIAH 42:16 NIV
One day when he was skiing in Colorado, a bloke saw some people wearing red vests with the words BLIND SKIER. He thought, 'I have a hard enough time skiing with two good eyes, how can they ski properly with none?' The answer was that they had a guide whose instructions they totally trusted and followed! As the guide skied beside them, he'd tap his ski poles together and assure them he was there. Then he'd say, 'Go right! Turn left! Stop! Slow! Skier coming up on your right!' What a picture. So often life can be like skiing downhill blind. We can't see even five seconds into the future. We can't see the struggles ahead or the steepness of the mountain right in front of us. It becomes even scarier when we think about all the other 'skiers' who've run into us, or over us in the past. Humanly speaking it leaves even the strongest of us feeling vulnerable and unsafe. And that's when we need to place our confidence in the God who never changes and never fails. Here's what He has to say to you today: 'I will lead the blind by ways they have not known, along unfamiliar paths. I will guide them; I will turn the darkness into light before them and make the rough places smooth. These are the things I will do; I will not forsake them' (Isaiah 42:16 NIV). What is it that gets you through the unfamiliar places, the dark places and the rough places in life? God's rock-solid promise: 'I will guide [you]...I will not forsake [you].' And His assurance is all you need!

content.title: Encouraged by your critics!
content.introtext:
THE LORD ANSWERED HIM, I WILL BE WITH YOU.

JUDGES 6:16
Life is a battle. Whether it's a battle with health, your friends, your enemies, your church leaders, your neighbours, your work mates, unemployment, money, peer pressure, parents, bullies, relationships with the opposite sex, depression or countless other things, life usually feels like it's 'one thing after another'. When you're in the middle of a battle, God has a strategy for you. Even if it's a battle you should never have got into (sinful habits or things that all your mates do) then God has a strategy to get you out. When you pray and ask God to help you in the battle, ask Him for a strategy to win the battle! God knows what you can handle, He knows the pressures you're under and He knows exactly how you're wired. God has a master plan for everything, even when the battle or mess you're in is your fault! One of the amazing things about God is His ability to turn even the worst possible situation around for His glory; but you can only do that by following God's strategy! Remember though, you may have already heard God's strategy but you're looking for another because you don't like it, or you want something easier. A God-given way out is not always pain-free. Sometimes it means owning up to things, admitting problems, confronting situations or, heaven forbid, actually apologizing! Coming through these situations is what helps us to grow up, mature and learn big lessons in life. You can't avoid them forever. So today think about your battles; maybe it's time to put into action that winning strategy you've been putting off for so long?

content.title: Protect your foundation
content.introtext:
BE ON YOUR GUARD!

ACTS 20:31 NIV
Years ago in California there were some enormous mud slides. Beautiful houses ended up being trashed as the earth literally slid out from under them. You see, when the foundation crumbles, even the most expensive houses will fall. Thank God that the foundation we have in Him can't be shaken... or can it? These days there's no shortage of Christian teaching; just turn on the TV or go online and it's there waiting for you. However, when you take a proper look you can see there's a teaspoon of truth in an ocean of error. Sadly some people hungry for a slice of fame can think of a new idea then find a Bible verse to back it up. But that's not what the Bible's there for. If you steal a few random words from here and there you can make the Bible say anything you want to say! In the Bible a group called the Bereans used their heads when it came to this. 'They received the message with great eagerness and examined the Scriptures every day to see if what Paul said was true' (Acts 17:11 NIV). Even the great leader Paul's words were checked against what scripture actually said, so no one is above this, including the Word 4U 2day! Anytime someone claims a revelation that doesn't line up with the Bible run the opposite direction. That may sound harsh but so is surgery and it'll save your life! So, always ask God to help you. Remember, Paul warned: 'men will arise and distort the truth in order to draw away disciples after them. So be on your guard!' (Acts 20:30-31 NIV).

content.title: Have you asked God about it?
content.introtext:
THE MEN OF ISRAEL LOOKED THEM OVER AND ACCEPTED THE EVIDENCE. BUT THEY DIDN'T ASK GOD ABOUT IT.

JOSHUA 9:14 TM
It's hard to stay humble when you've just walked through the Red Sea without getting wet and conquered Jericho, the biggest city in the Promised Land. But getting cocky can be deadly! After their massive victories the Israelites got way too big for their boots and totally forgot to ask God about what to do next, and the results were pretty bad. The crafty people from Gibeon realised they couldn't beat God's people so they sent out a team of negotiators to make peace with them and it worked! Joshua had no idea they were lying to him and signed a peace treaty. It was one of the biggest mistakes of his life! From that day on these people made life very difficult for Joshua and the twelve tribes who lived to regret that he 'didn't ask God about it.' You probably won't have to get involved in complicated military situations like that but that's no reason not to pray. It's frightening how quickly we can move from relying on God to relying on ourselves and it's way to easy to start trusting in a method because it worked in the past. Even worse is when we start living our lives a certain way just because 'that's what everybody else is doing'. Hearing from God for yourself is what gives you the edge, leaving Him out is what gets you into trouble. If you're the type of person who moves too quickly or tends to do things in your own strength, get praying. Ask God to let you know when you're moving on your own rather than with Him. It'll save you lots of heartache!

content.title: Seeing others the right way
content.introtext:
IF YOU LOVE SOMEONE YOU WILL...ALWAYS BELIEVE IN HIM, ALWAYS EXPECT THE BEST OF HIM.

1 CORINTHIANS 13:7 TLB
We humans are rubbish at seeing people for whom they could be. Most of the time we can't be bothered to look for what God sees in someone because all we see is faults! The problem is that the people you don't think much of probably have an amazing future awaiting them! In fact, if you knew their potential you'd keep your negative mouth shut and invest more time and energy into them. Remember Joseph? Don't make the mistake his brothers made. The person who completely does your head in today, could be the one you turn to for help tomorrow. So keep that in mind and treat them graciously! The point is, looks can lie, we need to go deeper. Remember Ruth, the immigrant working for less than minimum wage? She became the wife of Boaz, who owned the fields she worked in! In the future it's highly likely you'll meet a Ruth-type person so treat her like Jesus would! What about a more seasonal example? At the heart of the Christmas story is Mary, the mother of Jesus, looking for a place to spend the night and have her baby? It was the opportunity of a lifetime for a local inn-keeper to get in on the action and prepare the best room in the house to bring the saviour of the world into the world. But all except one left her and her unborn child out on the street. Don't miss a God-moment just because it's a bit inconvenient! Take another look at the person you don't think you have the time for. Ask God today to help you see what He sees in them!

content.title: You have the power!
content.introtext:
THE REASON THE SON OF GOD APPEARED WAS TO DESTROY THE DEVIL'S WORK.

1 JOHN 3:8 NIV
Happy Christmas! Today we celebrate Jesus being born in human flesh. Why did He come? 'To destroy the devil's work.' You're not expected to beat satan, Jesus already did that 2000 years ago. You're expected to put satan's defeat into action! Paul tells us in Colossians 2:15 that Jesus publicly embarrassed satan at the cross. When the American General Douglas McArthur finally confronted the Supreme Commander of the Japanese forces at the end of World War II, he stripped the glittering medals from the Commander's chest, took the sword out of his hand and as the world watched he declared total victory for the allies; and that's what Jesus did for you at the cross. When He died and rose again He stripped the devil of his power, removed his weapons and declared: 'All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me' (Matthew 28:18-19 NRS). So today is not just about a little baby wriggling in a straw-filled water trough. It's a day to recall the whole of that world-changing life and especially the fact that 'God exalted him to the highest place and gave him the name that is above every name, that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, in heaven and on earth and under the earth, and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father' (Philippians 2:9-11 NIV). Through Jesus the battle against evil has been won. Now, for us, the power we need is in the name of Jesus and He has made that power available to you. So don't forget the point of today keep that in mind!

content.title: Patience and discipline
content.introtext:
THE LORD DISCIPLINES THOSE HE LOVES'.

HEB 12:6 NIV
Today is really a day of waiting isn't it. The big day is tomorrow and who knows what surprises it will bring; socks again from Auntie Mildred, yippee! But seriously, waiting isn't easy, patience seems to be one of the hardest 'fruits of the spirit' to grow (Galatians 5:22). But God's patience with us is amazing! Have you ever thought about how frustrating it must be to be God? He creates people and fills their life with potential only to watch them blow it over and over again, yet every time He picks us up and encourages us that we really can do it if we'll rely on His strength and not our own. Here's something we all need to know though, alongside God's patience is his discipline. The Bible says: 'Do not make light of the Lord's discipline. Do not lose heart when He rebukes you. The Lord disciplines those he loves' (Hebrews 12:6 NIV). Don't expect to enjoy God's infinite patience if you treat Him with a 'you can't tell me what to do' attitude. If you're acting like that today, you need to deal with it sharpish before He deals with you! And when you do feel that heaviness inside that comes with God's discipline 'Do not lose heart'; don't go thinking God's rejected you just because He's pointed out something that needs sorting. It's the opposite, God correcting you is proof that you're His child and He loves you! Have you ever been told off by your favourite teacher or youth worker? It stings more from someone you like because their opinion really matters. Well remember that God's opinion matters even more!

content.title: Showing grace (2)
content.introtext:
HE GIVES MORE GRACE.

JAMES 4:6 NKJV
Ever noticed how your family can be the people you struggle most to have grace for? We're approaching Christmas, which is supposed to be a celebration. So we do we feel that our challenge between now and New Year is to just make it through alive? You have to endure the annual polite chat with the old person your parents claim you're related to, who may, if you're nice enough, leave you a wad of cash in the next few years. Then there's mum complaining 'it's her holiday too!'. We need loads of grace in Christmas; here are some more hints a) different viewpoints help you think things through. You may be arguing with someone because they're wrong but have you stopped to consider, just maybe they're right? b) never resort to making it personal. Disagreeing is one thing, destroying somebody is another. Just because someone is driving you mad or even winning the argument, resorting to verbal abuse might feel natural but it's totally out of order. If you must fight, fight fair c) when you lose, take it on the chin. Instead of going on about it all the time, 'Help others with encouraging words; don't drag them down by finding fault' (Romans 14:14-19 TM) d) sometimes you just need to call it a day and walk away. When Paul and Barnabas argued over whether or not John Mark should travel with them, 'There followed a sharp disagreement between them' (Acts 15:39 AMP). End of story? No, just the beginning of two different ministries! So be gracious! What's happening to you right now may well be God's way of moving you into a new area of blessing.

content.title: Showing grace (1)
content.introtext:
LET YOUR CONVERSATION BE GRACIOUS.

COLOSSIANS 4:6 NLT
You can try your best to 'live at peace with everyone' (Romans 12:18 NIV), but even so: 1) Conflicts and arguments will still happen. After all, life would be boring if we all ate the same food, wore the same clothes and watched the same channel. That's why there are so many ice cream flavours and styles of music! It's just as easy to be kind but firm or tactful and gracious as it is to be rude, critical and upset everyone. And that's especially true when you need to tell someone they did wrong. Paul says, 'If a Christian is overcome by...sin, you who are godly...humbly help him back onto the right path' (Galatians 6:1 TLB). 2) Even Christians won't always agree. If you see the world in black and white it's hard to understand how two mature Christians can seem to have such different opinions on so many subjects. When there are so many opinions you can't agree with everyone, but that's ok. God is gracious and puts up with our silly arguments and even when we're wrong about stuff, he still loves and blesses us! Maybe real maturity is about loving those who are wrong - and choosing your battles carefully! 3) Every point of view has a point. Growing up, most of us were taught that someone is right and someone is wrong and if you're right you get praised and if you're wrong you get told off. In reality it's often more like 'I-see-it-this-way-and-you-see-it-that-way'. So before you go letting people know who's right and who's wrong have a think; 'can I let somebody else be "right" sometimes, without backing down on what I believe?'

content.title: 'I've come too far to turn back!'
content.introtext:
IF THEY HAD BEEN THINKING OF THE COUNTRY THEY HAD LEFT, THEY WOULD HAVE HAD OPPORTUNITY TO RETURN.

HEBREWS 11:15 NIV
Any pilot will tell you that there's a point of no return. When you reach the end of the runway there's nowhere to go but up. It's fly or die! In Hebrews 11 you'll see a list of totally normal people who did some mad and crazy things because even when they were going through the hardest times imaginable, they stuck to their vision. If you never look back, going back is not even an option. When you decide to follow God not everybody will be happy about it. Your vision could be their nightmare. Your success could prove all things they said about you wrong, or remind them of the vision they abandoned. Usually the hardest place to follow your vision is at home. There are always so many people keen to remind you of what you used to be like and they're often unwilling to believe you can change! In order for God to move us on, the first thing he does is to make us uncomfortable. Until your faith factor is bigger than your fear factor you won't move! If you're at all comfortable, settled and content, don't expect God to give you more; you're not ready for it. When you start taking risks you'll pray like you've never prayed and stay as close to God as possible because it's all you've got. There's nothing like that sense of feeling frustrated and boxed-in to get your full attention on God. Bottom line: when you decide, 'I've come too far to turn back,' you'll start to see God's hand at work in your life!

content.title: The Favour Flava
content.introtext:
TASTE AND SEE THAT THE LORD IS GOOD

PSALM 34:8 NIV
Imagine the world is a big ice cream truck with loads of different flavours of ice cream for sale, in lots of different brightly coloured wrappers. What tends to happen is people pick the one that looks the tastiest or the most colourful. God wants His people to reflect His character and glory so that humanity will be drawn to Him. Think about this; God invented all the colours and flavours in existence so we can conclude that He is in fact the tastiest option. Which must in turn mean that if we are carriers of His presence we too should be the most colourful, interesting, vibrant, tasty and happy bunch of people on the planet! When Jesus was on earth He didn't have to beg people to hang out with Him. He was just Himself and people wanted to be where ever He was. Why? Because He was tasty; He left them feeling satisfied! Listen: 'Taste and see that the Lord is good' (Psalm 34:8). God is putting Himself out there to be sampled by who ever wants to try Him and He's chosen to do it through His people. When you hang out with your mates do they get a taste of Gods goodness? Did you know that you have God's favour on your life? Yep, it's true. Your life has two massive God sized thumbs-up. So, are you representing His favour to others? Listen: If you're one of God's children then you are blessed with heaven's best; you have the favour flava! He's done it so you can point others to Him but He also wants you to enjoy Him too!

content.title: Sure and Certain
content.introtext:
NOW FAITH IS BEING SURE OF WHAT WE HOPE FOR AND CERTAIN OF WHAT WE DO NOT SEE.

HEBREWS 11:1 NIV
We can be way too impatient! If God doesn't speak to us in the first five minutes of our prayer time we get up, shrug it off and decide 'He isn't talking today.' We need to develop teeth like a bull terrier to take hold of God in prayer and refuse to let go until we've received a 'sure word' from Him? (2 Peter 1:19). Listen: 'Now faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see'. There are two characteristics of faith; one is 'Sure' and the other is 'Certain'. So often people teach that faith is like jumping into a black hole but that's not actually true. Faith knows what God has said and because it is 'sure and certain' that He will do what He says, Faith helps us follows His directions even when we don't understand why He's leading us that way. How do we get faith? Well it tells us the answer in the Bible, 'Now faith comes by hearing and hearing by the word of God' (Romans 10:17 NKJ). It is vital that we spend time reading God's Word and listening to those who teach God's Word. Imagine that your faith is a muscle; the more you exercise that muscle the bigger and stronger it becomes. The more you listen to people talk about God and the more you read about Him for yourself, the stronger your faith will be when He asks you to follow Him. Even though you may not know where He is taking you, you'll be sure and certain that you can trust Him.

content.title: Mighty Warrior
content.introtext:
THE LORD IS WITH YOU, MIGHTY WARRIOR.

JUDGES 6:12 NIV
If you've felt attacked lately, get ready; God's about to show you what the fight is all about! The level of grief the devil is giving you says a lot about what God is building in you. Check out what the Bible says about Gideon (Judges 6): 'He was hiding from his enemies, threshing wheat in a wine press.' In other words; Gideon was freaked, busting up wheat in a wine shop! His fear had got the better of him and he was trying to do a job in the wrong place. So in God's true style He sends a big shiny dude to get Gideon's attention and tell him how it really is; the angel calls Gideon, "Mighty warrior.'" You see God recognises things in you that others don't; or even you don't! God sees you from start to finish. Do you have an idea or a dream that you know could never happen without God? Good, that's what God meant when He said 'Not by might nor by power, but by my Spirit' (Zechariah 4:6 NIV). Stop allowing other people to 'define you.' All you need is God's opinion. Nothing else matters. If He says you can do it, then you can. When God speaks to you He shows you what you've got, then helps you to use it. When Gideon said, 'I don't have what it takes,' the Lord replied, 'Go in the strength you have' (Judges 6:14), and 'I will be with you' (Judges 6:16). There's an important truth here: If you do what God asks, He'll help you and the results will blow your mind. Come on you Mighty Warrior!

content.title: Stop n Listen
content.introtext:
ANYONE WITH EARS TO HEAR SHOULD LISTEN AND UNDERSTAND.

MATTHEW 11:15 NLT
Hearing God is your top priority! Mary took the time to sit and listen to Jesus (Luke 10:39). You learn to hear from God by making time listen to Him! Fifteen times in the New Testament Jesus said: 'anyone with ears to hear should listen.' This tells you three important things: 1) you were born into God's family with spiritual ears; even if you are deaf in the natural your spiritual ears can hear God speak to your spirit 2) you have to use them - are your spiritual ears clogged up with worldy wax! 3 hearing from God must become your top priority. A baby is born with the ability to hear, but doesn't understand. Understanding takes time; it requires intimacy with their parents. Get the idea? Luke writes: 'Then He opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures' (Luke 24:45 NIV). Looking back over your life you realise that God has often talked to you, you just didn't understand what He was saying at the time, but later on you will. He's patient with you while you learn. Why does it seem easier to hear God's voice when you're having a rough time? It isn't, it's just that when things are tough, you're more keen to listen to him! Until that changes, you'll only go to Him in a storm and not hear what he's saying for your every day life. Jesus said, 'By myself I can do nothing; I judge only as I hear' (John 5:30 NLT). Jesus only did what His Father in heaven told Him to do; He wants you to learn to live that way too!

content.title: Set it Straight!
content.introtext:
SEE TO IT THAT . . . NO BITTER ROOT GROWS UP TO CAUSE TROUBLE AND DEFILE MANY.

HEBREWS 12:15 NIV
When someone upsets you, what's the first thing you do? Call your best mate and tell them what's just happened to you, not leaving out exactly what you think of the person who did it? But soon you'll say that you're over it and now you're moving on. Great! But what about the mate you unloaded on? Has your offence been passed over to them? Remember what you say will have an effect, whether for good or bad. Be careful what you say in the heat of the moment because it will shape the opinion of those who hear it. It's great when you can move from resenting others to forgiving them; but when you were angry did your words influence your mate's opinion of that person? James writes, 'My dear brothers and sisters...be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to get angry. Your anger cannot make things right in God's sight' (James 1:19-20 NLT). The writer to the Hebrews says: 'See to it that no one misses the grace of God and that no bitter root grows up to cause trouble and defile many.' Thoughtless words really do leave lasting damage. Let that stop you in your tracks! Maybe you need to set the record straight with those you've left feeling gutted over a situation you now feel differently about. It's tough but you need to do it. Swallow your pride, go back and straighten things out, until you do you won't be on the right side of God. Jesus said, 'If you... remember a grudge a friend has against you...go to this friend and make things right' (Matt 5:23-24 MSG).

content.title: Laziness Sucks!
content.introtext:
THOSE WHO WORK HARD WILL PROSPER.

PROVERBS 13:4 NLT
Have you ever met a lazy person; their favourite phrase is, 'I can't be bothered' and their day is littered with excuse after excuse for why they haven't done what's been asked of them. Has that lazy bones you know sprung to mind or are you reading this and thinking that the lazy person is actually you? Did you know that laziness will take your life down a dead end road? Listen: 'Lazy people are soon poor; hard workers get rich' (Proverbs 10:4 NLT). If you're lazy then every area of your life will suffer; your relationship with your parents, your friendships and your future. If you have an 'I can't be bothered' approach to life then you will find yourself looking back and wondering what you have to show for your life, whilst others seem to be zooming ahead. Of course hanging with your mates seems more appealing than studying. But if you apply yourself and make an effort you'll be surprised how much it pays off later on. Don't let the fear of failure stop you from trying. If you do mess up, get back on your feet and show the devil that he'll never get the better of you. God isn't lazy! He is always watching out for you. Guess what? He never sleeps! Don't panic, it also says 'He gives sleep to those He loves' (Psalm 127:3 NIV), but His purpose for your life doesn't come wrapped in a duvet. He wants you to be like Paul who said, 'I press on towards the goal to win the prize' (Philippians 3:14 NIV). Don't let life pass you by, grab hold of it today!

content.title: No Need 2 Worry
content.introtext:
DON'T WORRY ABOUT ANYTHING; INSTEAD, PRAY ABOUT EVERYTHING...THEN HIS PEACE WILL GUARD YOUR HEARTS AND MINDS.

PHILIPPIANS 4:6-7 NLT
Are you worried today? Is your mind feeling stressed? Listen: 'God cares for you, so turn all your worries over to him' (1 Peter 5:7 NCV). How? Talk to Him; getting God involved is the best thing you can do to help yourself. If you're not sure what to say here's some words to help you get started: 'Father, You told me not to be afraid 'cause You're with me, You've got my back, and those who have a go at me will have to deal with You too' (Isaiah 41:10-11). 'You said that if I hang out with you then you'll protect me from any nastiness the devil tries to throw at me. You've ordered Your angels to fight for me' (Psalm 91:10-11). 'You said when I'm in over my head You won't let me drown, and when the heat is on you won't let me get burnt 'cause You're watching out for me' (Isaiah 43:2-3). 'You said no weapon formed against me shall win' (Isaiah 54:17). 'I can't keep the enemy from trying, but I know that if I stick close to you he hasn't got a hope. You said if I ask anything You will, You'd do it' (1 John 5:14-15) 'and that if I do what You ask I will be blessed throughout my day and when I go to sleep at night' (Deuteronomy 28:6). 'You told me to give all my troubles to You and You would take care of me' (1 Peter 5:7). 'So here they are! Today I'm taking you at Your Word. You said it! I believe it! That settles it! Amen.'

content.title: Praying like Jesus
content.introtext:
THIS...IS HOW YOU SHOULD PRAY.

MATTHEW 6:9 NIV
Let's look at the prayer Jesus taught his disciples in Matthew 6:9-13. Every time you pray to your Father in Heaven it takes your friendship with Him to a deeper level. You're not only asking for God's input into your life but you're declaring your respect for Him. Because He really is your heavenly Dad you can have complete assurance that you are His. He's not just the Creator of the universe, He's your Father. You can create something and then not care much for it, but true fathers have an attachment of love to their child, forever. And there's more to this special prayer of Jesus... 'Hallowed be your name' means He's not just your Father, He's your God. You can love Him and be loved by Him, but God is God and He deserves your respect. 'Your kingdom come,' releases God's power. 'Your will be done,' releases His purpose. 'Give us today our daily bread,' releases His provision. The things you lack and long for begin to flow into your life because now you've accessed His power, discovered His purpose for you and now you're walking in it. 'Forgive us our sins, as we also have forgiven those who sin against us' Means it is easier to forgive when you recall the things God has forgiven you for. Remembering God's goodness to you will give you the grace to forgive others, and even understand them! 'Lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one' means we enter each day prepared for battle, promised victory, and protected against all of the devil's attacks. That's why Jesus said, 'This...is how you should pray.'

content.title: GUARD YOUR HEART (2)
content.introtext:
GUARD YOUR HEART, FOR IT IS THE WELLSPRING OF LIFE.

PROVERBS 4:23 NLT
Yesterday you read about the role your heart plays in relation to the rest of your life. What ever is in your heart will affect the rest of you; your attitudes, emotions, desires and motivation. So how do you guard your heart from the things that can have a bad affect on it? Here are some helpful tips: 1) When your mates start to talk about someone behind their back, don't join in. There is power in what you say, (James 3), so use your words for good instead of evil. 2) Make it a habit to think about good things 'I will praise the Lord at all times; his praise is always on my lips' (Psalm 34:1 NCV). Singing songs to God gets our focus on Him and off ourselves. It also reminds us how great God is and how we shouldn't let little things get to us. If something or someone starts to bother you, start to thank God for how good He has been to you and you'll soon chill out and move on. 3) Get to know His Word. When you read the Bible it shines a light on your path (Psalms 119:105) and helps lead you into good things rather than what is wrong. You will also get to know God's character so it will be easier to tell what things make Him happy and what doesn't. 4) Talk to Him. If something is bothering you, let Him know and ask for His help to deal with it. 'Trust in him at all times... pour out your hearts to him' (Psalms 62:8 NIV) and His peace will 'guard your heart today' (Philippians 4: 7)

content.title: Guard your Heart (1)
content.introtext:
GUARD YOUR HEART, FOR IT IS THE WELLSPRING OF LIFE.

PROVERBS 4:23 NLT
When you give your life to Jesus it says in the Bible that God gives you a new heart, 'I will give them singleness of heart and put a new spirit within them. I will take away their stony, stubborn heart and give them a tender, responsive heart' (Ezekiel 11:19 NLT). To understand what this means you need to know that the 'heart' talked about here isn't the ball of tissue and muscle that beats in your chest! God is talking about the centre of your attitude, emotion, desire and motivation; in old Hebrew thinking the 'heart' is all that, and more. Listen: 'Above all else, guard your heart for it is the wellspring of life' (Proverbs 4:23). Every aspect of your life flows from your heart. If you're jealous or angry it takes root in your heart; the core of who you are. It will influence everything that you choose to do. King Solomon refers to the heart as 'the wellspring of life'. A wellspring was the source of water for a community and if that well was poisoned the people who drew water from it would put their lives in danger. If you have allowed poison into your heart; the poison of jealousy, the poisonous words of gossip, then it will affect you whether you like it or not. How do you get rid of poison? Suck it out! How? Go to God and say sorry for letting that nasty stuff leak into your heart and then ask Him to make it clean again. Result! A fresh start, but don't fall for the same trap again. Remember to guard your heart!

content.title: Judging by appearances
content.introtext:
STOP JUDGING BY THE WAY THINGS LOOK.

JOHN 7:24 NCV
When country singer Lonzo Green's nephew Jimmy asked him to tune a friend's guitar, he agreed. The problem was, Jimmy's friend was from the wrong part of town and Jimmy's parents wouldn't allow him inside their house. So they met outside. As the kid approached he looked self-consciousness due to the funny looks he was getting from folks in this better-off neighbourhood. Lonzo, who'd experienced poverty and discrimination in his own life, tuned the boy's old guitar, played a few songs and taught him some chords. The young man thanked him and left with a tuned guitar and warm memory. Eventually that boy used his guitar to get out of the wrong part of town and was never unwelcome again. That's because the boy who wasn't allowed in the house was...Elvis Presley, a music legend who shifted over 100 million records! Jesus said, 'Look beneath the surface so you can judge correctly.' Jesus personally experienced the pain of rejection; even His 'own people...didn't want him' (John 1:11 TM). James later comments, 'how can you claim to have faith in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ if you favour some people over others? For example, suppose someone comes into your meeting dressed in fancy clothes and expensive jewellery, and another comes in who is poor and dressed in dirty clothes. If you give special attention and a good seat to the rich person, but you say to the poor one, "You can stand over there, or else sit on the floor" well, doesn't this discrimination show that your judgments are guided by evil motives?' (James 2:1-4 NLT). So, what do you think when you meet people who aren't just like you?

content.title: More mountaintop experiences
content.introtext:
I WILL NOT...SPEAK OF ANYTHING EXCEPT WHAT CHRIST HAS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH ME.

ROMANS 15:18 NIV
One day Jesus took some of His disciples to the top of a mountain. At the top something amazing happened to Him: 'His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became white as the light. Just then there appeared before them Moses and Elijah, talking with Jesus' (Matthew 17:2-3 NIV). Peter was so blitzed by the experience that he thought they should stay there: 'Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters - one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah' (Matthew 17:4 NIV). But Jesus said 'No,' and led them back down the mountain. At the bottom a crowd had gathered and immediately Jesus had to get stuck back to His miraculous work. It's good to have mountaintop experiences with God; but you can't stay there. There's work to be done! The Old Testament gives us similar pictures. The High Priest went into the 'Holy of Holies' once a year where he had the privilege of seeing the glory of the Lord, but God's work was done outside amongst the people! Amazing stuff also happened to Isaiah (Isaiah 6:1-4). He was carried to God's presence in sort of virtual-reality, but afterwards he had to go out and get on with the job God gave him. There's a balance. We must spend quality time with God, then 'come back down to earth' with the answers needed by those around us. Getting the idea? Well what better day than today to put this into practice. Make sure you set aside time for you and God and then come down from the mountain and get to work!

content.title: God's timing
content.introtext:
...THE REVELATION AWAITS AN APPOINTED TIME... WAIT FOR IT; IT WILL CERTAINLY COME...

HABAKKUK 2:3 NIV
God isn't random! Everything He does is deliberate. One way of understanding this aspect of God is to think about a diary full of appointments. The diary is to make sure that everything gets done on time and in the right order. And God has set times for things to happen in your life. You can count on that! Problems start happening when we try to rush God's timing. When God gives you a promise it's like a seed; it needs time to take root and bear fruit. Human life follows a similar cycle doesn't it? Everyone knows the order; mum and dad have sex (yes, even yours!), then the pregnancy, then the development in the womb, and finally the day of the birth. And what does mum-to-be do during this time? Prepare! She gets ready for parenthood because it won't be long before that little life announces, 'Ready or not, here I come!' The Psalmist writes: 'Don't be impatient for the Lord to act! Keep travelling steadily along his pathway and in due season he will honour you with every blessing' (Psalm 37:34 TLB). Maturity is about learning the difference between human timing and God's timing. Is that a lesson you still need to learn? If you learn it now it will set you up for life. If you don't want to risk delaying God's plan for your life, learn to sit tight listening carefully for His 'Now' word. The prophet said, '...the revelation awaits an appointed time... wait for it; it will certainly come...' So, whenever you get impatient, remind yourself, God said it and He will make it happen in His time!

content.title: No celebration without preparation
content.introtext:
...STRUGGLING WITH ALL HIS ENERGY, WHICH SO POWERFULLY WORKS IN ME.

COLOSSIANS 1:29 NIV
Do you want God's best for your life? Well, the easy path won't get you there, only the path of sacrifice will. It's not easy being the one putting the effort in when people around you are being lazy and making excuses. Like Jesus, in that long night of painful prayer in the Garden of Gethsemane, you may not have reliable people around you in your time of testing. Remember this little saying: There can be no celebration without preparation! You probably know people who've already given up on making a success of their life because they can't take the pressure. You can probably think of some examples of people who wanted success but couldn't handle it when it arrived. Hopefully you're different. You're the kind of person who isn't satisfied sitting on the sidelines; you're gonna go for it! Listen: if you have the passion, the price won't stop you. Some days you'll have tears in your eyes and dirt under your fingernails, but in spite of the scrapes and bruises, that holy passion will make you want to sing at midnight like Paul and Silas ( Acts 16:16-34), and give you a sense of mission that makes you cry out like Isaiah, 'Here am I, send me' (Isaiah 6:8 NIV). So if today is tough remember this blindingly obvious bit of wisdom: there's never been a day that lasted forever! Don't give up and don't give in. Bite your lip, wipe away your tears and stand on what God has promised you. And remember, you don't need to depend on your own strength, you have: '...all His energy, which so powerfully works in me.'

content.title: The meaning of life
content.introtext:
THEY LAY THEIR CROWNS BEFORE THE THRONE.

REVELATION 4:10 NIV
A lot of people race from one thing to another and never stick at anything. Living like this life is full of experiences but empty of meaning. The 'meaning' of life isn't revealed all of a sudden by trying lots of things until you find that one thing that contains the 'AHA' moment. Meaning is found bit by bit as we walk with God paying attention to the things he's telling us, especially in his Word, the Bible. There will never be anything that can replace the importance of God in your life. If you think you can find satisfaction just by doing lots of exciting stuff, think again! No matter what memories you create for yourself they all fade away over time. The only thing that will get better over time, if you are willing to give it time, is your relationship with God. Check this out: 'The twenty-four elders fall down before him who sits on the throne, and worship him...They lay their crowns before the throne and say: "You are worthy, our Lord and God"' (Revelation 4:10-11 NIV). Did you see that? In this heavenly picture the elders not only worshipped God, they laid their crowns at His feet. What are those crowns? Well it's quite likely that they're a symbol of the things achieved in this life, things that become worthless before the throne of Almighty God. Sometimes we just need to lay it all down, look up and say, 'Lord, I need to spend time with You!' Truth is, your achievements may bring you some happiness, but only in God's presence will you find 'fullness of joy' (Psalm 16:11 NAS).

content.title: Through the storms!
content.introtext:
THE WEATHER CHANGED ABRUPTLY, AND A WIND OF TYPHOON STRENGTH... BLEW US OUT TO SEA

ACTS 27:14 NLT
Paul travelled a lot and so he knew that at any time the conditions might change for the worse. And it wasn't just the weather he had to watch out for, people's attitudes towards him changed too. Even some of his closest friends walked out on him (2 Timothy 4:9-12). So what lessons can we learn from this? 1) Life involves storms, but they do pass. 'When neither sun nor stars appeared for many days and the storm continued raging, we finally gave up all hope of being saved' (Acts 27:20 NIV). There will be days when you'll wonder how you're going to make it but by God's grace you will! 2) Storms show how well you know God. 'Last night an angel of the God whose I am and whom I serve stood beside me and said, "Do not be afraid, Paul,"' (Acts 27:23-24 NIV). It's the tough times that reveal the strength of your God-connection. 3) True leaders stand out in an emergency. In this story the ship's crew had to throw stuff overboard, then in an attempt to get to dry land they got stuck. Paul stood up and spoke words of faith that enabled everyone to carry on. 4) Often the worst thing that could have happened turns out for the best. God used this shipwreck to reach the island of Malta with the Gospel. Notice what happened to Paul as he left the island: 'when the time came to sail, people supplied us with everything we would need for the trip (Acts 28:10 NLT). Stop worrying, God will provide what you need; you're His child and you will get through the storms!

content.title: Don't try this on your own (4)
content.introtext:
'JESUS I KNOW, AND PAUL I KNOW...BUT WHO ARE YOU?'

ACTS 19:15 NIV
We're gonna spend just one more day on this intriguing incident: 6) Don't bother using the name of Jesus unless you have made Him Lord. Paul knew about Jesus, he met Him face-to-face on the dusty Damascus Road and his life was revolutionized. And the same will happen when you make Jesus the Lord of your life; no, not just your mate, your boss! Then you can use His name in all its true power. 7) Why settle for anything less than a direct relationship with Him? These guys said, to the spirit, 'Come out in the name of that same Jesus that Paul preaches about!' (Acts 19:13 CEV) Er, aren't you giving the game away there guys? You don't know this Jesus at all do you? No wonder they took such a beating! If these guys had just stopped for a minute to consider that Paul's ability to heal and deliver people was not found in his own special power but through his relationship with the One 'who has gone into heaven and is at God's right hand-with angels, authorities and powers in submission to him' (1 Peter 3:22 NIV). Have you got that direct relationship with Him? If not you can enter into it right here and right now. Jesus is only a prayer away. You don't need to say any fancy words, you just need to be honest about the fact that you've been going your own way. Then you need to tell Him that you want today to be a U-turn day when you're going to stop following your own feelings and start following Him. You can look in the back cover of this devotional for some more help to get you connected :-)

content.title: Don't try this at home (3)
content.introtext:
'JESUS I KNOW, AND PAUL I KNOW...BUT WHO ARE YOU?'

ACTS 19:15 NIV
Today we're going to squeeze a bit more out of the story we started on Saturday. 4) When the 'evil day' comes there's no pretending! (Ephesians 6:13). The evil spirit in this tormented man exposed the weakness in the seven religious brothers. In a demonic freak-out he took them all on them and before they knew what'd hit them they were running out of the house naked, stripped of their pretence. Don't try this at home unless you know you've got the real thing! Are you ready to drop your wisecracks to simply stand on His Word? Have you been through the time of testing when you follow Jesus even when you can't understand or explain where He's taking you? It's better to be honest about where you're at than to get yourself in over your head. 5) Demons don't have a database! The evil spirit in this man spoke out: 'Jesus I know, and Paul I know...but who are you?' Satan isn't all-knowing like God. Yes, he has his evil agents stalking around here and there generally causing mayhem but they can't keep up with the advance of God's Kingdom. Plus, even if the demons of Ephesus had a hit-list these guys wouldn't have been on it, they were no threat to the Kingdom of Darkness, but are you? Maybe you're still dealing with your own lack of confidence saying, 'I can't do anything, I'm rubbish.' Listen: It's not you the enemy is afraid of, it's the Spirit of God that's in you! 'Greater is He that is in you, than he that is in the world' (1 John 4:4).

content.title: Don't try this at home (2)
content.introtext:
JESUS I KNOW, AND PAUL I KNOW...BUT WHO ARE YOU?

ACTS 19:15 NIV
So what else can we learn from the scrap we read about yesterday involving the sons of this Jewish priest guy? 1) Success is not as easy as it looks! These men showed up later on in Paul's ministry. They weren't there in the beginning when he was blinded by an encounter with the risen Jesus on a dusty out-of-town road. They were looking for shortcuts that just aren't there! When you see someone else doing great things it can really get you fired up to want to do it too. However, only a short-sighted person expects to achieve overnight what it took years of experience to bring them into. 2) Big numbers don't necessarily mean big results! These seven men together couldn't do what one Spirit-empowered Jesus-follower did. Yes, their dad was one of the top priests, so they knew plenty about 'religion', but they were a classic case of: 'Having a form of godliness, but denying its power' (2 Timothy 3:5 NIV). 3) Those around you are not always with you!
